text: Tridrepana fulva is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by George Hampson in 1893. Note: This source gives 1892 as the year of description. It is found in Tibet in China, Sikkim in India and Nepal. The wingspan is about 44 mm. Adults are bright fulvous yellow, the forewings with traces of two dark specks beyond the cell in the interspaces between veins 2 and 4. The hindwings are uniform fulvous yellow. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1893 Category:Drepaninae
title: Tridrepana fulva
